radiographic_examinations.findings: The gallbladder is distended, with wall thickening measuring up to 9 mm, and gallstones are seen within the gallbladder. A positive sonographic sign is elicited. No significant pericholecystic fluid is seen, and the common bile duct is normal in size measuring 3 mm. The visualized liver is normal in echogenicity. Limited views of the kidneys demonstrate no hydronephrosis. The pancreas is normal in appearance.
